choices.C: It configures encryption for MD5 HMAC.
choices.B: It configures the network to use a different transform set between peers.
choices.A: It merges authentication and encryption methods to protect traffic that matches an ACL.

discussion.content: Encryption is aes so it cannot be D. Authentication is HMAC so it cannot be C.
wrong answer. Right answer are C and D. (ciscoexam.online/ccna/210-260/601)

questions.answer_description:
The crypto ipsec transform-set myset esp-md5-hmac esp-aes-256 command merges authentication and encryption methods to protect traffic that matches an
ACL.

questions.question_text: Which type of secure connectivity does an extranet provide?

choices.D: new networks to your company network
choices.A: other company networks to your company network
choices.C: your company network to the Internet
choices.B: remote branch offices to your company network

questions.answer_description:
Extranet or external network provides secure connectivity to other company networks from your own companys network.

http://searchenterprisewan.techtarget.com/definition/extranet

questions.question_text: In which three cases does the ASA firewall permit inbound HTTP GET requests during normal operations? (Choose three).
questions.answer_description:
During normal operations, ASA firewall permit inbound HTTP GET requests when a matching TCP connection is found and a matching ACL entries are configured or when the firewall requires HTTP inspection.
Reference:
https://supportforums.cisco.com/document/69281/asa-using-packet-capture-troubleshoot-asa-firewall-configuration-and-scenarios

questions.question_text: If a switch port goes directly into a blocked state only when a superior BPDU is received, what mechanism must be in use?
questions.answer_description:
The Root Guard feature can be enabled on all switch ports in the network off of which the root bridge should not appear (that is, every port that is not a root port , the port on each switch that is considered to be closest to the root bridge). If a port configured for Root Guard receives a superior BPDU, instead of believing the BPDU, the port goes into a root-inconsistent state. While a port is in the root-inconsistent state, no user data is sent across it. However, after the superior BPDUs stop, the port returns to the forwarding state.

The BPDU Guard feature is enabled on ports configured with the Cisco PortFast feature. The PortFast feature is enabled on ports that connect to end-user devices, such as PCs. It reduces the amount of time required for the port to go into forwarding state after being connected. The logic of PortFast is that a port that connects to an end-user device does not have the potential to create a topology loop. Therefore, the port can go active sooner by skipping STPs listening and learning states, which by default take 15 seconds each. Because these PortFast ports are connected to end-user devices, they should never receive a BPDU.
Therefore, if a port enabled for BPDU Guard receives a BPDU, the port is disabled.
Reference:
https://learningnetwork.cisco.com/thread/4575

discussion.content:
stats:
block - it's root guard
disable - it's bpdu guard
